abstract: New York Giants cornerback Terrell Thomas, hurt in contract year, opts to undergo knee operation and rehabilitation in Los Angeles, with same doctors and trainers who helped him when he was hurt in college; says he hopes to return to the Giants, but acknowledges the reality of his situation.
snippet: This time it was different when Giants cornerback Terrell Thomas injured his knee. This time it might have cost him tens of millions of dollars.
lead_paragraph: This time it was different when Giants cornerback Terrell Thomas injured his knee. This time it might have cost him tens of millions of dollars.

headline.main: Seeking Reward, Giants Cornerback Found Risk Instead
headline.seo: Terrell Thomas’s Injury Underlines Risk for N.F.L. Players in Contract Years
